Reviews.Title: “Great stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: carewsn
Reviews.Content: Paulo, the owner, was very helpful. He offered so many neat ideas for us to do. He also helped us make reservations and arranged for a early morning ride to the airport at a very reasonable price. He took us to a great place to take pictures of the city, Rome. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom facilities were clean as well and more than adequate. Paulo also made sure we had a light breakfast and coffee every morning, even when we left at 0700.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: I'm a first-time B&B user. This one was a great experience. Paolo, the host, is wonderful - spoke clear English, anything we needed he accommodated. The place is clean, comfortable, updated; very conveniently located to the many things to do in Rome, specifically the Vatican, Hop On Hop Off bus, various public transits, many restaurants. Without hesitation, I would request to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kelly L
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at this B & B in April 2012. Paolo was a wonderful host, very helpful with anything we needed or information we requested. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable. You are within a five minute walk to the Vatican and St. Peter's Square, the bus stops for the tour buses, local grocery and nice places to eat. This was our first time in Rome and Paolo helped make it a great visit. Breakfast provided each morning was very nice and the refrigerator was stocked each day. Would stay here again upon a return visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: snowinface
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the bed and breakfast in Sept. 2011. We had a great time, and Paolo is a very good host. He will give you all the inside info necessary for Rome. The location is perfect and you can walk almost anywhere you want in the city. It is a great value also.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Rome B & B”
Reviews.Author: Darryl26144
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I and my wife's cousin stayed at Paolo's B & B in September 2011. The rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. They were air conditioned rooms. The decor is very attractive. The Location is excellent with the Vatican Museum very close by and St Peter's Square within an easy walking distance. We used the Hop On Hop Off bus to see Rome's historic sights and the bus stop was near St Peter's Square so once again easy to walk to. Paolo gave us many ideas of what to see and do and also where to eat at very nice restaurants. He is very helpful and obliging. Breakfast was very good and self serve in the Breakfast room. It is a great place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Our first time staying at a B&B”
Reviews.Author: Cari1966
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay ever at a B&B, and it was a very possitive experience. We found the B&B on the internet and after have been reading the comments on the tripadvisor, we booked a room. The room was nice and it was very clean. It would have been nice with a topmadras on the bed :-). The bathroom was not big but was recently renovated and was very nice looking and very clean. There´s wiresless internet which we really apreceated. In the room were the breakfast is served, there´s a small fridge where there is water, juice and youhurt which is avaible all day and it was also possible to make coffee and tea.It was also one of the things which we were happy with. Paolo( the host) is very helpful and speaks perfectly english.The location of the B&B is perfect. It´s in a nice neighborhood and in walking distance to the center of Rome. We will without a doubt recommend this B&B to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, great location, great host”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in September 2011. Paolo is a very welcoming host, arranging a taxi from the airport and marking up a map of places to visit. The B&B is around 200m from the Vatican wall and is very comfortable. A friend recommended it to us and we will definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Location and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: brvancouver
Reviews.Content: Great location, safe and quiet and clean, in walking distances to major buses and metro stations, couple of blocks from the Vatican. Paolo, the owner, very interesting personality, friendly and chatty, speaks perfect Spanish and English on top of Italian. The room does not have Wifi, and we needed to confirm a tour booking, Paolo checked for us and even offered and called the tour company to clarify for us some information, very gracious host.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great host”
Reviews.Author: maleo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the B&B Cuscino e Cappuccino - Rome San Peter from Sept 4th to 8th, 2011. Paolo is a fantastic host, he arranged for a taxi on our arrival. He was very helpful in suggesting places to visit and when to go. Thanks to that we avoided the lines at the Vatican and Coliseum. He also made reservations to the Galleria Borghese. The pizza place he recommended was fabulous. We walked everywhere and it was very nice to get back at night to the B&B and be able to have a tea/coffee/ juice. Location: Great, the Vatican is a few steps away and the Metro is only a few blocks. Breakfast: Juices, yogurt, breads for toast, sweets, coffee, warm milk and bottles of water in the fridge. Room: clean, quiet, comfortable, and secure (English channel TV). We will definitely stay here again and we don’t hesitate to recommend it to anyone visiting Rome. A couple from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Cuscino Cappuccino and would recomend it to everyone”
Reviews.Author: AustinMoran
Reviews.Content: Paolo arranged for a pick up from the airport to his address which was wonderful especially after such a long flight which was late getting in.He advised us on what to see and do in Rome and the icing on the cake was a very special trip just south of Rome.Our trip to Rome was made extra special because of Paolo. The rooms in his B&B were very clean, safe and comfortable also very quiet even though its on a busy street. The location of Cuscino Cappuccino is excellent just a few hundred meters from the Vatican and a couple of blocks from the subway and walking distance from just about anywhere you wanted to go.Besides being very very satisfied with this B&B . Paolo was what made everything exceptional.Such a personable guy, willing to go out of his way to make things nice. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and experience in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: CarlsonC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights after spending 4 nights in a 5 star hotel in Florence. She was apprehensive about staying here after such posh treatment but I sold her on it as it allowed us room in our budget to hire guides to see the wonders of Rome. We were both glad that we did. Paolo is friendly and respectful and gave us several great tips on how to enjoy Rome inexpensively. The room is exactly as pictured - clean, quiet and comfortable. The location is great - right next to the Vatican (as in hundreds of yards away) and right next to the Metro. It is not a five star experience but I give it 5 stars because I can't imagine getting more for the money. If we had to do this over we would have spent 3 nights in Florence and 4 nights in Rome. Florence is beautiful and Gucci but ridiculously expensive. Rome is a grittier but warmer and filled with an unbelievable amount of history and charm. When we come back we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: amartin1908
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic B&B just around the corner from the vatican. Paolo was an excellent host who was there to welcome us on our first evening when we arrived late. The rooms are of a good size and extremely clean. The rooms offer up free air conditioning and have the most fabulous black out windows. You can close the windows, which kills the outside noise completely and relax. Breakfast is ample. There is a choice of yoghurts, cereals, juice, pastries and toast. Table always set up each morning. The breakfast area is quite intimate, but we were lucky enough not to have to share the table at breakfast time. Eating out is quite expensive, however there is a restaurant directly across from this B&B which is much cheaper than a lot of the places around. We went back there several times as we were tired of getting ripped off everywhere else. The salads are to die for. They come in massive bowls with heaps of topping and all for around 8 eruros. I paid 12 euros elsewhere for a bowl of green lettuce and two spoonfuls of prawns. I would definitely recommend this B*B and having stayed at another one on my previous stay in rome it is far superior. Definitely stay here again Paul & Amanda

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic B&B around the corner from Vatican!”
Reviews.Author: Marketa02
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Rome and I stayed at the Cuscino e Cappuccino B&B. This little B&B is run by its owner Paolo whom I found to be exceptionally friendly, helpful and he really went beyond the call of duty to accomodate my needs, answer all my questions and provide me with information. My room was lovely, modern, the bed very comfortable and everything was super clean. The B&B is located conveniently just around the corner from the Vatican City so I walked absolutely everywhere. I had an amazing time and it was partly because I was so well looked after by Paolo. I definitely recommend staying there and I hope to go back soon. Marketa (London)

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: viking2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in May 2011. The reviews on tripadvisor were instrumental in our choosing this place. It is perfect for visiting the Vatican and also very close to both the metro and the bus system. The owner Paulo is very friendly and accomodating. The rooms are very clean. Breakfast is cereal, juice, toast and coffee and some individually wrapped pastries. The coffee is excellent. You can also make instant coffee and tea at any time and there is always juice and water and yoghurt in the fridge. The rooms are very quiet. The price is under 100 euro so is quite affordable for Rome. Paulo will also arrange a ride to or from the airport for 40 euros, and he willingly did that for us the day we left Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in rome!”
Reviews.Author: gholms
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend, both in our 20's, spent 4 nights at the guesthouse and found it to be perfect for our needs. We were given a very warm welcome by Paolo along with some great tips about when to see the various sites. The rooms are clean and well decorated, the location is great (2 minutes from the vatican), and the breakfast is great too! The area around the hotel is pretty good, its close to the tube and everything in Rome is walkable. Really couldnt fault this place as we both enjoyed our stay! I'd stay here again and would reccomend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: nandanorth
Reviews.Content: We travel often and stay at hotels. This was our first experience in a B&B and our first visit to Rome. C&C is quaint and very well situated near the Vatican and within easy walking distance to many sites, the metro, and restaurants in a safe neighborhood. The rooms are well maintained and clean. Breakfasts were satisfying and made more pleasurable meeting and talking to the other guests. C&C offers great value for the money. Most importantly, Paolo is a wonderful host who made us feel at home instantly. He provided excellent recommendations for sites to see and gave us an insider’s perspective of all that Rome has to offer. We recommend C&C to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place for the budget conscious traveler”
Reviews.Author: MLHenry
Reviews.Content: C&C was a great choice for my husband and I on our first trip to Rome. Simple, clean, safe and affordable - C&C is a great choice for travelers who are less concerned about the amenities of thier room, and more focused on experiencing the city. Breakfast was included and very satisfying. The location was also very good as it is walking distance to the Vatican, Metro and bus stops. I will recommend this hotel to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, very, well located, clean, attentionate host, calm rooms”
Reviews.Author: verodoux
Reviews.Content: Paolo is very nice and cares for his hosts. It is 2' away from St Peter, we walked everywhere from there. Very clean and calms rooms. We'll return for sure. 3 rooms, all renovated, possible to go as friends, couple or with a child. Location is reallt great, tips from Paolo useful as well. Une chambre d'hote accueillante et propre, au calme, à 2 minutes de St pierre. Paolo parle bien anaglais, paiement par carte bleu accepté.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for our first trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dwerryhouse84
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased that we chose the Cuscino e Cappucino B&B for our first trip to Rome. We stayed there for three nights and were very happy with our spotlessly clean room, as well as the great location...within walking distance of many of Rome's attractions. Paolo, the owner of the B&B, was very friendly and ready to assist us with any of our needs. He was also helpful in showing us where to go and how to get there. He arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport, and then arranged for a taxi to take us anywhere we needed to go. If we were to go to Rome again, we would certainly use this B&B again. Jim and Carole Donaldson, Denver, CO

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: careittopp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this B&B when in Rome and then returned for one additional night after visiting Florence and Venice. We cannot say enough about the hospitality and service provided by Paolo, the owner. We felt so safe and comfortable at his B&B that we could not wait to return for the last night of our wondeful trip to Italy. The B&B is located in an excellent spot--right across the street from the Vatican. You can see the Vatican wall out of the window of one of the very comfortable and extremely clean rooms. Paolo is the owner and he makes your stay very memorable and very much worth staying at his B&B. He is very helpful with all the questions we had when we first arrived. He is so very proud of his city and wants to make certain that you have a perfect stay. The rooms are very, very clean as is the entire place. He is ALWAYS available to assist you and can provide information for all your needs. We left Rome to travel to Florence and Venice for a few days. The apartments we rented were nice but neither compared to his hospitality and his B&B. He is so very friendly and certainly made our first visit to Rome a memorable one. When returning to Rome we certainly will stay at Cuscino e Cappuccino again. Also I need to say that the pictures on the website do not do justice for the B&B. It is a really nice and comfortable place....and certainly worth checking out.....you will not be disappointed in any way....

Reviews.Title: “A great location for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: lisasobba
Reviews.Content: This B&B was more than we expected. It is in a very safe and handy part of Rome. Paolo was an excellent host. Our rooms were clean and tidy, easy to unpack and get ready for sightseeing. Paolo was kind enough to set up transportation to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Made Rome worth it”
Reviews.Author: sem063
Reviews.Content: Paolo was friendly and helpful by giving us a map and demonstrating places to see in our limited amount of time we had in Rome. He also has many other books and resources to use while you stay there. We took one of the Rome tour books with us to each sight which was great to be able to read about the history of each place as we were right there. It was wonderful to have a comforable place to come back to after a long and full day of sight seeing. The breakfast was the most pleantiful that we have ,complimentary style, thus far in Europe. The fridge has several drinks that are for the taking during your stay as well. Location was very close to the Vatican and Metro. We enjoyed the exercise into the city and we able to walk to all of the main attractions from the hotel and back from 7am to 3pm, omitting the Vatican museum. Street was a bit noisy at night, but we were so exhausted that we didnt have trouble sleeping. We did not hav good luck eating near the B&B or in Piazza Navona. Overall a great deal for the money spent considering it is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great and central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pritipaliwal
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay. very warm and cosy. Modern and clean and nice. Great service and the best part is the location. its very central. I think it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful B&B, just perfect for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: MooDee
Reviews.Content: Our party occupied all 3 rooms in the apartment, 2 doubles and 1 triple. The apartment was very clean, comfortable and spacious with the owner Paolo on hand in the apartment next door. Paolo is very friendly and approachable, he served breakfast at the time that was convinient for us and always made time to advise us on our trip. The apartment is a few minutes walk from St Peter's Basiica, the Ottaviano station is only up the road and there are alot of buses from the main square around the corner, it is the perfect location for a city break. This was my third visit to Rome and this was the best accomodation that I have had in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perferct location: super friendly owner; super close to many sights.”
Reviews.Author: CityHopper029
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cuscino e Cappuccino for three nights and it was perfect. Paolo was super friendly and helpful. The rooms are very nice and clean and it is quiet during the nights. The B&B is next to Vaticano so you can check out the line at the Vatican Museum and St. Peters. Several busses and tram leave just in front of the B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: tratlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the B&B during our honeymoon. We initially wanted to go to more expensive hotel but after few friends have told us that we will not spend much time in the room we decided to go to B&B. Our friends were right, we did not spend much time at the room but the room was great. All I can say about this B&B is WOW! Host was great, he let us use his phone, gave us map and basically was there for whatever we needed. We had the red room (The room overlooking Vatican wall). The room was clean, bathroom was small but clean, room was large by European standards, smaller by American standards. I would have to agree with a review above that the bed is hard as a rock, my husband did not mind it but I used a tip from above (folded blanket) and I was fine. It was quiet despite being in the busy street. Those windows are amazing they are sound proof I swear. We were allowed to use mini bar in the common room that was filled with water and juices. Breakfast was basic, sweet pastries, bread, nutela, cereal, coffee, tea and milk. There is a TV in the room with few English channels (BBC, Bloomberg, Pentagon and few more). As I said we were not in the room much so we did not watch TV. I gave it 4 on the location because it is not ideal location for everyone, it was for us, but it might not be for everyone. We did walk everywhere (Rome is much more compact that you can imagine) even to Coliseum which is the farthest sight form the B&B. If you stay here you must check out Blue Bridge gelato place across Vatican wall, the best banana gelato I ever had. Also the restaurant on the way to the Vatican Museum (recommended by Rick Steves) is also great mussels are to die for.

HotelInfo.Name: Cuscino e Cappuccino
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vespasiano 9, 192 Rome, Italy
